title: Concretizer stuck in dead loop (only) when spec is used as package dependency
body:
Disclaimer: I'm a spack newbie so bear with me if the way I'm using things is totally off. 

When trying to build a custom package a specific spec used in a `depends_on` clause causes the Concretizer to fail (stuck in a dead loop), while the same spec works just fine via `spack spec`.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Works:
```console
$ spack spec "py-numpy@:1.16 -blas -lapack ^py-setuptools@:44 ^python@2.7:2.8"
```

Gets stuck:
```console
$ spack spec banana
```

With `banana/package.py` defined as
```python
from spack import *

class Banana(AutotoolsPackage):
    """Just a banana."""

    homepage = "http://banana.net"
    url = "http://banana.net/banana-1.0.0.tar.gz"

    version('1.0.0', sha256='c3e5e9fdd5004dcb542feda5ee4f0ff0744628baf8ed2dd5d66f8ca1197cb1a1')

    depends_on('py-numpy@:1.16 -blas -lapack ^py-setuptools@:44 ^python@2.7:2.8')
```
The reasoning for the spec is that I'm trying to constrain Python to version 2.7.

_Unrelated side note_: as per the [documentation](https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/basic_usage.html#version-specifier) I tried `^python@:2.7` but that also didn't work as expected. I would have expected the latest safe 2.7.x version to be selected that way but the Concretizer resolved it to 2.7 (unsafe) instead of 2.7.18. Thus I changed it to `^python@2.7:2.8` which I saw done for builtin packages as well (only ok as long as there's no version 2.8 being made available).

### Error Message

None, because of dead loop (CPU at 100%). Debug mode shows it gets stuck while/after:
```
Reading config file [...]/spack/etc/spack/defaults/packages.yaml
```


### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.15.1 (fresh/vanilla installation, default `packages.yaml`, 29 packages installed)
* **Python:** 3.7.3
* **Platform:** linux-debian10-zen

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
